title.narrative: 1. Research Knowledge and Mobilization : 1.3 Documentation of GBV cases

description.narrative: Documentation of direct and indirect cases of violations against women with disabilities whereby women with disabilities are more empowered by receiving legal and psychosocial support.

activity-date.narrative: DOCUMENTATION OF DIRECT AND INDIRECT CASES OF VIOLATIONS AGAINST WOMEN WITH DISABILITIES

title.narrative: Information on the status of People with Disabilities throughout the quarantine period including collecting data on the rules and regulations pertaining PwD care throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. (Language: English)

description.narrative: Data collected from government officials among others showing the difficulties and hurdles facing PwD during the lockdown including reaching medical health. (Language: Arabic)

title.narrative: The project gathered information on the status of People with Disabilities throughout the quarantine period including collecting data on the rules and regulations pertaining PwD care throughout the COVID-19 pandemic.
information on the status of People with Disabilities throughout the quarantine period including collecting data on the rules and regulations pertaining PwD care throughout the COVID-19 pandemic.
Mapping of GBV cases and PwD in the media throughout 2020

description.narrative: Understanding if/ how PwD have been affected during the COVID-19 pandemic with a focus on the topic of GBV . Data collection was manually carried out by I Am Human staff, and only includes Arabic content

title.narrative: Mapping of GBV cases and PwD in the media throughout 2020
The outputs of this activity were achieved as planned with additional intervention developed based on findings during documentation as follows:

description.narrative:  134 field visits to document GBV cases of women and girls with disabilities by 6 trained field workers in Karak Ajloun Sweileh and Zarqa as well as Tafileh. All age-groups are represented  431 women with disabilities were assessed by a psychosocial, disability and legal experts , out of which 171 cases of violations against women were identified and documented on a case by case basis. All disabilities types (Hearing impairment, visual impairment, motor impairment, intellectual disability) are represented.  Referrals of 171 cases were made to lawyers , psychosocial experts , occupational therapy, speech therapist, physiotherapy and some cases were referred to business incubators . The process of referral is still undergoing. 40% of targeted women empowered.  150 women with disabilities received direct legal and psychosocial assistance by the socio legal centers. The remaining cases are to be followed during the second year of the project.  171 affidavits from victims of gender-based violence particularly disabled women were signed.  One of the main findings during the assessment was the need for mobility aids, therefore the project’s partner provided multiple mobility aids to 94 people with disability including wheelchairs, Crutches, walkers, bath wheelchair, beds and oxygen tubes.  6 Advocacy meetings :With the outbreak of the COVID 19 pandemic and the post-pandemic consequences especially in regards to domestic violence and violence against women and women with disability, 6 meetings were held with members of the parliament and stakeholders from the Ministry of Social Development, the Higher Council for the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, Ministry of Political & Parliamentary Affairs, Human Rights Department at the Prime Ministry, Human Rights Center , to set the ground to advocate for the implementation and activation of the law on the Rights of People with Disabilities (PWD) which was endorsed by the Jordanian Lower House in May 2017 but is not exercised. February 2020- October 2020  Monitoring of violations against women with disabilities in the media : A data with documented cases including cases of violence against women with disability during the COVID 19 pandemic was built in addition to a concept paper highlighting the impact of the Covid - 19 crises on women with disabilities. January 2020- October 2020  Music Therapy sessions :During the documentation of direct and indirect cases of violations against women with disabilities in the allocated governorates Amman (Sweileh), Zarqa, Ajloun and Karak, carried out by trained field workers, it was evident that there are cases which will require continuous follow up and referral to the Institute for Family Health GBV Centers to receive psychosocial support. With the approval of the Netherlands Embassy, survivors of GBV and family violence who were referred to the GBV centers also participated in music therapy sessions ; a rehabilitative practice similar to physiotherapy sessions conducted by KHF sister organization the National Music Conservatory. 100 GBV survivors from the GBV centers in Karak, Amman, Zarqa and Ajloun were divided in a group of 12 persons per session and attended at eight sessions ( 12 hours per group) to ensure effective relief and impact. The sessions were conducted by 8 professionals with multidisciplinary educational backgrounds in fields including music theory and history, biological and natural sciences, behavioral sciences, and courses specific to music therapy. Annex : reports

title.narrative:
20% of women empowered.
All disabilities types (Hearing impairment, visual impairment, motor impairment, intellectual disability) are represented.
All age-groups are represented
400 legal and psychosocial assistance
